item.title: Half tonne of cocaine retrieved from WA waters off Lancelin, as livestock vessel chief charged
item.description: Police charge the chief officer of an international livestock carrier and three others, after half a tonne of cocaine was found floating off Western Australia's coast.

item.title: ElecraNet to explore alternative options for Northern Transmission Project after farmers voice concerns
item.description: ElectraNet are shifting their focus east, after farmers voiced concerns about renewable energy line Northern Transmission Project running through prime cropping country.

item.title: How last year's AFLW grand final loss made the Brisbane Lions rethink everything
item.description: Brisbane returns to the AFLW grand final with a new game plan to tackle the unbeaten, reigning premiers.

item.title: Port Pirie clean-up efforts continue after thunderstorms slams SA town
item.description: Port Pirie residents and businesses are picking up the pieces after record-breaking thunderstorms hit town over the weekend.

item.title: NZ has halted access to puberty blockers. What does the rest of the world do?
item.description: New Zealand has become the latest country to halt access to puberty blockers for young people with gender dysphoria but are they following best health practice or an outlier?

item.title: NT Health calls for new facility as Royal Darwin Hospital recovers from Tropical Cyclone Fina
item.description: The Northern Territory's largest hospital is "literally creaking at the seams" after Tropical Cyclone Fina, prompting NT Health to call for more federal funding.

item.title: Brazil's ex-president Jair Bolsonaro says 'hallucinations' made him tamper with ankle monitor
item.description: Former Brazilian president Jair Bolsonaro says medication he takes for hiccups made him so paranoid that he used a soldering iron to tamper with his court-mandated ankle monitor while under house arrest.

item.title: Severe thunderstorms and hail damage crops in WA's South West and Great Southern
item.description: Farmers in southern WA say crops have been destroyed by hail and trees "snapped like matchsticks" during weekend thunderstorms.

item.title: Donald Glover reveals he had a stroke last year which forced him to cancel his New World tour
item.description: Despite a "really bad pain" in his head, Donald Glover performed a full show before heading to the hospital where he was diagnosed with a stroke.

item.title: Senate shut down for 1.5 hours after Pauline Hanson's burka stunt
item.description: The rare break in proceedings came after One Nation's Pauline Hanson strode into the chamber wearing a burka and then refused to leave after being slapped with a sanction.

item.title: Australia no guarantee to pick Usman Khawaja for second Ashes Test at Gabba
item.description: Australia coach Andrew McDonald has failed to guarantee Usman Khawaja will be selected for the second Ashes Test, even if the under-pressure veteran opener is fit.

item.title: Bureau of Meteorology boss reveals website rebuild 'approved and funded' by Turnbull government
item.description: The Bureau of the Meteorology's new chief executive has blamed a "miscommunication" for the furore that has erupted over a costly and controversial website redesign.

item.title: Nikhil Chaudhary becomes first Indian to score Sheffield Shield century in the 2000s
item.description: Nikhil Chaudhary has become the first Indian to hit a Sheffield Shield hundred this century, helping put Tasmania in a position of utter dominance against NSW.

item.title: What is really in a vape?
item.description: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

item.title: Bollywood superstar Dharmendra dies in Mumbai, aged 89
item.description: India's Prime Minister Narendra Modi is one of many to pay tribute to the icon of Indian cinema.

item.title: Jimmy Cliff, reggae music pioneer, dies at 81
item.description: Cliff was known for singles You Can Get It If You Really Want It and Many Rivers To Cross, as well as for his cover of Johnny Nash's I Can See Clearly Now.

item.title: Cotality Housing Affordability Report shows 'extraordinary rise' in home values
item.description: Home prices have risen by almost 50 per cent in the past five years, with more than a decade now needed to save for a standard 20 per cent deposit for a house in most capital cities, according to a new report.

item.title: Kangaroos star Ash Riddell wins AFLW best and fairest award
item.description: Runner-up to Adelaide's Ebony Marinoff last year, Riddell polled 23 votes to add the league's highest individual honour to her fifth All-Australian selection.

item.title: Volodomyr Zelenskyy warns Ukraine peace plan cannot change borders
item.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy warns his country's borders "cannot be changed by force", highlighting a key sticking point in negotiations with the US over a potential peace deal with Russia.

item.title: US labels Maduro-tied Cartel de los Soles a terror organisation — but experts question whether it exists
item.description: The designation — which is unusual, as experts say it isn't a real organisation — is the latest measure in the Trump administration's escalating campaign to combat drug trafficking into the US.

item.title: Xi Jinping tells Donald Trump Taiwan's 'return to China' is key to international post-war order
item.description: Chinese state media reported some of what was discussed in the phone call that took place on Monday, local time.

item.title: Gaza Humanitarian Foundation closes as ceasefire holds
item.description: More than 800 Palestinians died in the vicinity of Gaza Humanitarian Foundation aid sites after it took over the distribution of all supplies in the strip in May.

item.title: Court dismisses criminal cases against Donald Trump critics James Comey and Letitia James
item.description: Former FBI director James Comey and New York Attorney-General Letitia James had been charged shortly after Donald Trump used social media to instruct his attorney-general to take action against them.

item.title: Gambling ad ban would pass parliament with a conscience vote, Labor MP says
item.description: Macarthur MP Mike Freelander believes the multi-partisan support for restricting gambling advertising means the reforms will "get there" eventually.

item.title: Terminally ill man allegedly abused as a child at Ashley detention centre fights to access records
item.description: The family of a dying man asked for his records from Tasmania's only youth detention centre, Ashley. They were told it could take eight months — time he does not have.

item.title: Bitcoin crash unsettles financial markets, with 'contagion' fears surfacing
item.description: It's been a wild ride for bitcoin traders in recent months and, after a weekend of crypto and blockchain enthusiasm at a Sydney convention, sceptics continue to flag the risks.

item.title: Emergency department wait times for mental health patients stretching over 23 hours, report finds
item.description: New data shows some patients with serious mental health conditions have been waiting more than 23 hours for a bed in emergency departments.

item.title: Why APRA wants to slowly deflate the property bubble
item.description: Amid global warnings of impending financial doom, APRA and the Reserve Bank are far more concerned about a home-grown bubble, one that's been taking in oxygen for almost three decades.

item.title: The 28-point peace plan for Ukraine mostly contains the same points previously made by Moscow
item.description: A detailed look at the 28-point plan — as it has been reported — shows some very minor concessions to Russia. But it mostly contains all the same points that have always been made with more or less force by Moscow.

item.title: Marufa Akter is inspiring Bangladeshi girls in a 'revolution' for women's cricket
item.description: From ploughing rice fields during COVID, Marufa Akter’s remarkable rise to Bangladesh cricket star has inspired a generation of girls to take up cricket.

item.title: Andor and Death by Lightning costumer designer Michael Wilkinson creates worlds with fabric
item.description: Michael Wilkinson won an Emmy for his intricate costumes in the celebrated Star Wars series Andor. Now, he is recreating 1880s America for Death By Lightning.

item.title: Sydney photographer Gavin Libotte captures 'magic in mundane' with Wanderland collection
item.description: Animals and objects dwarf humans in Gavin Libotte's unique perspective on suburban life, challenging the way we see the familiar world.

item.title: Yancoal begins plans to extend life of central Queensland coal mine to 2070
item.description: Yancoal begins plans to extend the life of its central Queensland coal mine, which would see roughly 74 million tonnes of coal extracted over the life of the mine.

item.title: Queensland teachers strike for second time this year after rejecting 8 per cent wage rise
item.description: Parents and guardians have been asked to "make alternative plans" for their children as Queensland teachers walk off the job after rejecting pay offer.

item.title: Calls for independent legal representatives for victim-survivors of sexual violence in Australia
item.description: A new report by victim-led advocacy organisation With You We Can makes the case for all victim-survivors of sexual violence to have access to independent legal representation.

item.title: Experts respond to myths and truths around living with migraine and how to get treated
item.description: More than 1,000 people got in touch directly with the ABC to share their experiences with migraine and now the experts have weighed in.

item.title: Federal politics: Pauline Hanson suspended from Senate for seven sitting days over 'disrespectful' burka stunt — as it happened
item.description: One Nation leader Pauline Hanson has been censured by the Senate and suspended for seven sitting days, a day after she wore a burka in the chamber to push for the garment's ban. Take a look back at the day's coverage here.

item.title: Victorian government blocked fire service from pursuing US giant over PFAS contamination
item.description: The ABC can reveal that in 2023 the Victorian government blocked Fire Rescue Victoria from pursuing legal action against PFAS manufacturer 3M.

item.title: Cloncurry copper mine set to inject $17 billion into Queensland's economy
item.description: South Africa's largest gold producer, Harmony Gold, has officially signed off on a significant outback copper mine that is set to boost Queensland's economy by $17 billion.

item.title: Ash Riddell credits Kangaroos teammate Jasmine Garner after winning AFLW best and fairest award
item.description: Ash Riddell says her close relationship with North Melbourne teammate Jasmine Garner helped her win the AFLW's best and fairest award.

item.title: Thousands of women missing out on program dubbed maternity 'gold standard' care
item.description: A free "gold standard" antenatal care program is proving hugely popular and successful, but women are scrambling to get access.

item.title: Bendigo Bank shares dive on money laundering worries, but ASX gains ground — as it happened
item.description: Australian shares gained ground on Tuesday, despite Bendigo and Adelaide Bank shares plunging more than 7 per cent after "deficiencies" in anti-money laundering systems were uncovered.

item.title: Severe thunderstorms slam southeast Queensland
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Pep Guardiola apologises to camera operator after confrontation in Manchester City's Premier League loss
item.description: Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola apologises to a camera operator after an incident during his side's Premier League defeat at Newcastle United.

item.title: China's regional trade pact bid derails as Australia stalls and Japan tensions deepen
item.description: China's escalating confrontation with Japan is colliding directly with its attempt to join one of the world's most demanding trade agreements.

item.title: Will the WA government's 'Perth Park' rebrand of Burswood motorsport precinct win over doubters?
item.description: The WA government will be hoping its second crack at rebranding this project will capture the public's imagination, or it may be back to the drawing board.

item.title: Everton's Idrissa Gueye sent off for slapping teammate Michael Keane in Premier League match
item.description: Idrissa Gueye is involved in a heated moment with Michael Keane during Everton's Premier League match against Manchester United.

item.title: How Ash Riddell's rise to become AFLW's best mirrors Kangaroos' dominance
item.description: Overlooked in multiple drafts before making her debut in 2019, North Melbourne's Ash Riddell is now the best player in the league.

item.title: Townsville man advocates for pancreatic cancer awareness after diagnosis
item.description: A Townsville man says there were no warning signs before he was told he had terminal cancer.

item.title: Nick Kyrgios's Australian Open wildcard campaign boosted with Kooyong Classic entry
item.description: Nick Kyrgios's Australian Open wildcard campaign is on in earnest after the former Wimbledon runner-up was announced in the Kooyong Classic exhibition field.

item.title: Sister Kate's site to become home to Perth's first Aboriginal aged care facility
item.description: The 100-bed facility will be constructed on a site where Stolen Generations were taken to against the will of their parents.

item.title: Joel Cauchi's psychiatrist gave 'wildly inconsistent' evidence, Bondi Junction Westfield attack inquest hears
item.description: The counsel assisting the coroner says Joel Cauchi's former psychiatrist showed an "exceptional level of belligerence and confrontation" at the inquest.

item.title: What's feeding our fascination for murder mysteries and crime series?
item.description: In an era of grim news and uncertainty, audiences are consistently drawn to murder mysteries. But what's behind that enduring fascination for the genre?

item.title: Bird flu confirmed in elephant seal population at Heard Island
item.description: The federal government says testing confirms the presence of avian influenza in samples collected from southern elephant seals on Heard Island — a sub-Antarctic Australian external territory.

item.title: Detainees involved in rooftop protest at Banksia Hill detention centre moved to Unit 18
item.description: WA's corrective services minister says three of the youths involved in last night's disturbance at Perth's juvenile detention centre have been moved to the notorious Unit 18, as he continued to take a hardline stance on youth detention.

item.title: Nauru president says NZYQ members could go home in interview about secretive deal
item.description: David Adeang said in an interview conducted in Nauruan that members of the NZYQ cohort could be returned to their home countries and suggested Australia should remain partially responsible for finding a longer-term solution for the group.

item.title: Jakarta overtakes Tokyo as world's largest city, according to UN
item.description: For decades Tokyo held the title of the most populous city on the planet. Yet the Indonesian and Bangladeshi capitals have overtaken the Japanese megacity.

item.title: Labor to squeeze public service, sparking warnings of job losses
item.description: After it campaigned against a Coalition pledge to cut 41,000 public servants, Labor is ramping up its own efficiency drive in a move expected to cost jobs.

item.title: Rare earth element exploration in early stages in SA Mallee region, with more drill testing to come
item.description: A publicly listed resources exploration company says it will conduct further testing in early 2026 after initial drill samples show promising results.

item.title: US revokes immigration status for Myanmar nationals, points to 'sham' elections as progress
item.description: The US government is ending the temporary legal status of thousands of Myanmar nationals arguing they can safely return to the war-torn South-East Asian country.

item.title: Thousands to endure heatwave without power, as Sunshine Coast towns hit by intense storm
item.description: A Queensland coastal town may go without power for days in heatwave conditions as it cleans up after a ferocious storm.

item.title: West Coast Eagles draftee Josh Lindsay wants to carry on Troy Selwood's legacy
item.description: West Coast draftee Josh Lindsay has opened up about the devastation of losing his mentor Troy Selwood, saying the former Brisbane tagger played a vital role in helping him get on an AFL list.

item.title: How to take care of yourself online postpartum
item.description: New mum Hannah Gheller says social media became a “shame-inducing tool” during the early postpartum weeks.

item.title: Damaging winds close Dubbo's Service NSW Centre as severe weather hits inland NSW
item.description: Wild winds of up to 100 kilometres per hour have battered inland New South Wales, with strong gusts knocking out the windows of a Service NSW building in Dubbo.

item.title: Hobart City Council proposes residents vote on merger with Glenorchy
item.description: Talk of councils merging is a long-running topic in Tasmania — and with Hobart councillors expressing an openness to merging with nearby Glenorchy, the issue is live again.

item.title: Australia's 2026 Census to include new questions on gender and sexuality in expanded topics list
item.description: For the first time, Australia's 2026 Census will ask participants to identify their sexual orientation and gender in a new topic in the population questionnaire.

item.title: Kangaroos star Emma Kearney puts pressure on AFLW rivals to raise standard ahead of third straight grand final
item.description: Emma Kearney says the pressure is on other clubs in the AFLW to raise their standard to North Melbourne's ahead of the club's third straight grand final.

item.title: Pat Cummins continues recovery by bowling with pink ball ahead of Gabba day-night Ashes Test
item.description: Injured Australian cricketers Pat Cummins and Josh Hazlewood have bowled in the nets as the pace stars attempt to return from injury for the Ashes.

item.title: First issue of Superman becomes most expensive comic ever sold
item.description: The edition was found by three brothers while they were cleaning out their late mother's San Francisco home. Now it has become the most expensive comic ever sold.

item.title: Barnaby Joyce's looming defection could spell trouble for the Nationals
item.description: At the end of this week, Barnaby Joyce will either confirm his exit from politics or join One Nation — at least, that is the binary choice the maverick former deputy prime minister has set for himself.

item.title: City of Joondalup councillor Nige Jones cautioned after claiming strip club drink as council travel expense
item.description: A local councillor who tried to get reimbursed for a drink he bought at "the best strip club in Australia" during a work trip describes the incident as a "genuine mistake".

item.title: Tasmania defeats NSW by an innings for first Sheffield Shield win, Sam Konstas out for 19 in second innings
item.description: Former Australia batters Sam Konstas and Kurtis Patterson have been dismissed cheaply in NSW's crushing innings and 58-run Sheffield Shield defeat to Tasmania.

item.title: Tuesday finance with Alan Kohler
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Michelle Heyman 'uncomfortable' with missing ALW matches to play for Matildas
item.description: Michelle Heyman is 'uncomfortable' with the A-League Women continuing without international players as the Matildas prepare for their last matches before the AFC Women's Asian Cup.

item.title: Clean-up bill for asbestos scare at SA schools tipped to exceed $1.5m
item.description: SA's Minister for Education, Blair Boyer, is calling on retailers to help pay the climbing clean-up bill for removing coloured sand products linked to the asbestos scare.

item.title: Federal government backtracks on reducing default speed limits
item.description: The truck industry has welcomed a federal government decision to walk away from lowering speeds on unsigned roads, but road safety experts question the move.

item.title: Japan scrambles jets after suspected Chinese drone spotted near Yonaguni island near Taiwan
item.description: The incident comes amid an ongoing diplomatic spat between Tokyo and Beijing.

item.title: Trump orders peace envoy to meet Putin in Moscow to progress Ukraine plan
item.description: Donald Trump says he has instructed his special envoy, Steve Witkoff, to meet Vladimir Putin in Moscow to discuss a "fine-tuned" peace plan for Ukraine.

item.title: FBI to interview Democrats who urged US military to ignore illegal orders
item.description: It comes after the six US politicians appeared in a social media video that Secretary of Defense Pete Hegseth described as "seditious".

item.title: How a daughter's 'puzzle' inspired the Polaroid camera and the 'instant photo'
item.description: On November 26, 1948, the first Polaroid camera was released commercially, changing photography forever.

item.title: Do you know fact from fiction in the world of forensic science?
item.description: Forensics has provided the biggest breakthrough in criminal justice in the last century. It's also become the perfect subject matter for TV crime shows. But do you know forensic facts from fiction? Take our quiz to find out.

item.title: Scammers and dodgy middlemen sell Indonesians a way to win 'war' for an Australian visa
item.description: Thousands of young Indonesians want the chance to come to Australia to work, but first they have to win a visa application "war" that puts them in the sights of scammers and dodgy operators promising them what they want — for a price.

item.title: Coalition makes tax cut pitch to young in bid to restore lost credibility among voters
item.description: Shadow Treasurer Ted O'Brien will address the National Press Club on Wednesday.

item.title: Women's Asian Cup underdogs India a 'realistic' chance to qualify for World Cup, coach says
item.description: Ranked 63rd in the world, India will need to finish ahead of Japan, Vietnam and Chinese Taipei to progress through next year's Women's Asian Cup and have a chance at their first-ever World Cup qualification.

item.title: A 13-year search for one of the world's rarest flowers in Indonesia ends in a 'magical experience'
item.description: A team of researchers describe the "magical" experience of finding a rare species of flower in bloom deep in the Sumatran rainforest after a 23-hour trek.

item.title: Researchers discover rare blooming flower in Sumatran rainforest
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Pope Francis's Popemobile transformed into mobile clinic for Gaza children
item.description: A former "Popemobile" used by Pope Francis during his 2014 tour of the Holy Land has been transformed into a mobile health clinic for Gaza's children, but Israeli authorities are yet to give permission for it to enter the war-ravaged strip.

item.title: TGA says some vitamin B6 to be removed, prescriptions needed after toxicity cases
item.description: After a rising number of Australians reported suffering from B6 toxicity, the TGA has been forced to act and remove some supplements from shelves.

item.title: APY Lands community members disappointed after delay into hearing on governance
item.description: Anangu Pitjantjatjara Yankunytjatjara (APY) Lands community members have been left disappointed by a last-minute decision to halt a hearing that was set to probe governance issues in the region.

item.title: Australia's east to get extreme weather with heat, winds and catastrophic fire danger
item.description: Eastern Australia is facing a barrage of extreme weather conditions this week, and for many areas the most intense conditions will arrive today.

item.title: Lurker explores fans, obsession and modern fame
item.description: In a world where celebrities are accessible on social media in a way they never were before, has fame lost its shine? A new film explores the parasitic relationship between stars and their fans.

item.title: Concerns for pollination industry and beekeepers as varroa mite worsens across NSW
item.description: The cost of treating varroa mite in the beekeeping industry is flowing onto other food growers reliant on pollination.

item.title: Why tens of thousands of houses ready for construction can't proceed
item.description: Four years after buying a housing plot, the Websters' land is still vacant, without a water or sewer connection, and they have now been told to expect those services by 2028.

item.title: Community concerned over proposed Woodlawn waste-to-energy facility at Tarago near Canberra
item.description: Farmers near Tarago in southern New South Wales fear a proposed waste-to-energy incinerator could threaten their health and livelihoods.

item.title: Palestinians left without shelter after Gaza tent cities flood again
item.description: Heavy rain causes significant flooding in Gaza, with thousands of Palestinians living in tents bearing the brunt of the sudden burst of winter weather.

item.title: Storms to continue across Queensland in 'hot, humid, unsettled' weather
item.description: The south-east corner braces for severe storms for the third day in a row, while much of Queensland swelters under humid heatwave conditions.

item.title: Federal politics: MPs in the dark as lights switch off during Question Time — as it happened
item.description: Some MPs turned to their phone torch lights after the lights briefly turned off during Question Time.

item.title: Traditional owners travel to Darwin as fight over aquifer reaches NT Supreme Court
item.description: Dozens of Aboriginal Territorians from remote communities travelled to Darwin where they stand alongside Environment Centre NT in a bid to axe a controversial water allocation plan.

item.title: Scientists and Indigenous rangers partner up in trial restoration of Great Barrier Reef
item.description: From growing baby coral in floating pools to using Indigenous cultural knowledge, this trial hopes to regrow the Great Barrier Reef.

item.title: Strikers pip Heat in final-ball WBBL thriller to record six-wicket win
item.description: With scores ties before the last delivery of the match, the Adelaide Strikers pull off a tense victory over the struggling Brisbane Heat.

item.title: Schools close as hot weather and dangerous fire conditions forecast across NSW
item.description: Dozens of schools across NSW are forced to close as a combination of severe weather conditions creates dangerous fire conditions not seen in years.

item.title: Residents, developers, investors camp out to secure blocks of land in Broome
item.description: A number of people slept in front of a real estate office in Western Australia's far north on Monday night in an attempt to purchase a block of land.

item.title: Aussie dollar rises on inflation pick-up, ASX off highs but closes in positive territory — as it happened
item.description: Hotter inflation sees the Australian dollar bounce, as the ABS releases its first monthly consumer price index. The ASX closes up after an upbeat session on Wall Street as the odds of a December interest rate cut jumped above 80 per cent.

item.title: Central Queensland Fitzroy Resources coal mine sale secures 1,000 jobs
item.description: A newly formed Queensland company has taken over a majority shareholding in a Bowen Basin coal mine, securing 1,000 jobs.

item.title: Polystyrene boxes blown in high winds cause damage in Mango Hill
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Cristiano Ronaldo set to avoid World Cup ban as FIFA confirms draw shake-up
item.description: Cristiano Ronaldo will likely avoid missing any Portugal matches at the men's World Cup, despite receiving a red card in a qualifier.

item.title: Invasive Species Council blames government for booming rabbit numbers
item.description: Landholders across Australia say rabbit numbers in some areas are at levels never seen before.

item.title: 'We're not asking every department to cut their staff by 5 per cent': Chalmers
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Optus blames 'significant' outage in Frankston and the Mornington Peninsula on vandalism
item.description: More than 14,000 Optus services south-east of Melbourne were affected by the Wednesday morning outage, which the telco says was caused by vandals attempting to steal copper.

item.title: Sir Richard Branson's wife Joan Templeman dies aged 80
item.description: A down-to-earth Scottish woman who preferred to stay out of the spotlight, Ms Templeman was frequently credited by Sir Richard as a stabilising force on his career, providing a counter-balance to his extravagant personality.

item.title: Why convenience stores along Fremantle cafe strip are the front line of WA's illegal tobacco trade
item.description: Convenience stores along the popular strip are scarcely stocked with chocolate bars and chewing gum but it's the merchandise under the counter that's really paying the rent.

item.title: Voter study shows Coalition loses status as better economic manager
item.description: The results of Australia's most prominent election study show Peter Dutton was the least popular leader in four decades.

item.title: Experts urge minister to do more to support youth detainees after Banksia Hill disturbance
item.description: For most, the absence of youth detention from the headlines after years of chaos would have been an indication things were working well — but Monday's troubling disturbance shows just how much still needs to be done.

item.title: Zach Merrett gives up Bombers AFL captaincy after failed Hawks trade
item.description: Zach Merrett steps down as Essendon men's captain after his failed trade request to Hawthorn left his position untenable.

item.title: Mental Health beds at Hobart's Peacock Centre have been closed due to a rat infestation
item.description: A rat infestation has forced the temporary closure of Peacock House, one of Tasmania's few public inpatient mental health facilities.

item.title: Childlike or childish? How these artists are tapping into their inner child
item.description: Whether it's enormous puppets, interactive bunny installations or handmade ceramics, these artists are embracing joy, whimsy and silliness to help people connect to their inner child.

item.title: Family of deceased woman sues Geelong Hospital over alleged medical negligence
item.description: Court documents allege the hospital breached its duty of care while caring for Port Fairy woman Jennifer Buchanan.

item.title: First Nations people say the Darling Baaka River is sick. A report confirms it
item.description: For months, people in remote Indigenous communities have been reporting skin rashes after going in the water, and a report confirms something is wrong with the river.

item.title: Australians with dementia urged to revisit the past to slow illness' progression
item.description: Helena Popovic took her father on a trip home to Serbia after he was diagnosed with dementia and believes its reminiscence therapy slowed the condition's progress.

item.title: New monthly inflation data shows jump from 3.6pc in September to 3.8pc in October
item.description: Inflation jumps to 3.8pc in October, up from 3.6pc in September, according to new complete monthly data from the ABS.

item.title: Sydney same-sex marriage mural of Tony Abbott marrying himself painted over
item.description: Possibly the longest ever wedding ceremony is now over for former prime minister Tony Abbott, after Scott Marsh's mural was painted over.

item.title: Allegations NSW Premier Chris Minns took thousands of dollars from unnamed donors a decade ago referred to ICAC
item.description: The allegations are included in an affidavit by a former ALP state organiser, which was tendered during a secret hearing of a parliamentary inquiry.

item.title: Matildas prepare to face New Zealand with one eye on 2026 Asian Cup
item.description: Ahead of two friendlies against their trans-Tasman rivals, the Matildas are mindful they cannot waste any time in the build-up to next year's Asian Cup.

item.title: UN AIDS body says Trump's foreign aid cuts have killed people and left millions without medicine
item.description: The United Nations body charged with fighting the spread of HIV says the Trump administration's cuts to the US foreign aid budget have sent the global aid response into "crisis mode".

item.title: Moody's downgrades Tasmania's credit rating to lowest of all Australian states
item.description: A major credit rating agency has downgraded Tasmania's credit rating, a move described by a prominent economist as a "vote of no confidence" in the government's fiscal strategy, but brushed off by the treasurer who says he is "not alarmed".

item.title: The human brain goes through five 'non-linear' stages of development, according to new study
item.description: The data showed there is "non-linear change across development" in the brain, suggesting it does not continue on one steady progression throughout your life.

item.title: 'It's one of the great joys of life': Russell Crowe on the Ashes Test
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Millennials are the first generation to move left as they age, rewriting the rules of Australian politics
item.description: Millennials are bucking trends, becoming an increasingly progressive voting bloc and rewriting the long-held rules of politics, writes Isabella Higgins.

item.title: Property affordability crisis triggers surge in outback NSW land values
item.description: The combined value of land in NSW passes $3 trillion for the first time, as the affordability crisis sees property prices skyrocket in remote towns.

item.title: Australia slips down Lowy Institute Asia Power Index that's still dominated by US and China
item.description: The latest Asia Power Index shows Australia slipping behind Russia for influence, while the region remains dominated by the US and China.

item.title: Robert Irwin wins Dancing with the Stars — a decade after sister Bindi
item.description: The son of late wildlife conservationist Steve Irwin wins Dancing with the Stars US, lifting the coveted Mirror Ball trophy a decade after his sister won the same title.

item.title: Man killed and 117,000 without power as storms lash Sydney and western NSW
item.description: A man has died after he was struck by a tree during a series of storms that have lashed New South Wales.

item.title: Ex-Brazilian president Jair Bolsonaro starts serving 27-year jail sentence for attempted coup
item.description: Former Brazilian president Jair Bolsonaro begins serving a 27-year jail term for an attempted coup against Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva in 2023.

item.title: Outgoing Fringe director reflects on leading Australia's biggest arts festival
item.description: After returning from the UK to direct the Adelaide Fringe in 2015, Heather Croall has seen the festival's ticket sales pass the 3-million mark and box office sales reach nearly $30 million.

item.title: Government planning crackdown on perpetrators of economic abuse estimated to cost nearly $11b a year
item.description: The federal government is consulting on major reforms to reduce financial abuse, including making it harder for directors to be appointed without clear consent. Economic abuse is estimated to cost the economy nearly $11 billion a year

item.title: How Amanda's ex used technology to gaslight and abuse her
item.description: Amanda's husband always seemed to just know things. When fiddling around with her social media settings, she discovered how he had been using technology to gaslight her.

item.title: One year on from a landmark inquest, advocates say the NT's domestic violence crisis is worsening
item.description: A year after NT Coroner Elisabeth Armitage handed down 35 recommendations from a landmark domestic violence inquest, those on the frontline say things are going backwards.

item.title: Operation Topaz investigators uncover $25m owed to ATO amid worker exploitation probe
item.description: An investigation into farms and labour hire businesses in Queensland's agricultural heartland have uncovered $25 million in unpaid taxes, according to federal authorities.

item.title: Sunshine Coast Council backflips on decision to scrap New Year's Eve midnight fireworks
item.description: Sunshine Coast Council has caved to public pressure and will resurrect its Mooloolaba midnight fireworks display, bringing the region into line with other Queensland towns.

item.title: Federal police union warns Labor 'austerity' drive would undermine security
item.description: An apparent request across the public service to find and suspend low-priority spending would undermine security if applied to the AFP, according to its union.

item.title: King Edward Memorial Hospital baby death leaves parents Alana and Paul Starkie seeking answers
item.description: A WA family has been devastated by the death of their newborn son at Perth's premier maternity hospital, and are desperate for answers on how the delivery of their fourth child went so tragically wrong.

item.title: World's Strongest Woman winner stripped of title as organisers claim athlete was 'biologically male'
item.description: An Australian strongwoman has been dramatically promoted to second at the world championships after the winning athlete was stripped of the title because of claims she was "biologically male".

item.title: Labor accused in Senate of turning blind eye to Nauru corruption allegations
item.description: Greens senator David Shoebridge reads what he alleges to be extracts from a secret AUSTRAC report that has not been made public, in the Senate late on Tuesday.

item.title: Social media age ban faces High Court challenge as government declares it will not be 'intimidated' by legal threats
item.description: Australia's social media age ban is being challenged in the High Court on the grounds that it restricts young teens' implied right to freedom of political communication.

item.title: Wallabies Test match fixtures for 2026 released, Les Kiss faces Eddie Jones in first match as coach of Australia
item.description: Incoming Wallabies coach Les Kiss will launch his tenure against Eddie Jones's Japan, Australia's 14-Test schedule for 2026 shows.

item.title: ACCC warns of 'sophisticated' ghost stores ahead of Black Friday, Cyber Monday sales
item.description: With Australians expected to spend billions this Black Friday, the consumer watchdog is warning about a growing number of "ghost stores" targeting unsuspecting shoppers and posing as local businesses promising premium goods, when in reality they are shipping fast fashion from overseas.

item.title: Taiwan announces $61 billion defence budget to defend itself against China
item.description: Taiwanese President Lai Ching-te says the budget was introduced for the country to defend itself in the face of a rising threat from China.

item.title: Socceroos placed in second pot for FIFA Men's World Cup draw in United States
item.description: The Socceroos, by pot luck, have avoided some of the sport's strongest nations for the 2026 World Cup pool stage.

item.title: NACC chief executive apologises to parliament for inaccurate evidence
item.description: National Anti-Corruption Commission chief executive Philip Reed writes to parliament apologising for inaccuracies in evidence given during Senate estimates.

item.title: Joondalup Councillor Nige Jones resigns for 'personal reasons' after submitting expense claim for strip club drink
item.description: A City of Joondalup councillor, who lodged an expense claim for a drink he bought at a strip club, resigns from the council citing "personal reasons".

item.title: Staff evacuated, calls for ADF assistance after Cyclone Fina wrecks Tiwi College
item.description: Staff have been evacuated from a remote boarding school on the Tiwi Islands, and students may not be able to return to classrooms this year, after Ex-Tropical Cyclone Fina tore through the region with devastating force on Saturday night.

item.title: Crews restore Sydney train services after wild weather, 'normal timetable' expected
item.description: Sydney Trains says engineers worked through the night to inspect and rectify damage after severe weather brought down trees onto power lines, impacting energy supply to the network.

item.title: Academics hit back after leading universities seek changes to key environmental legislation
item.description: Australia's top universities have aligned themselves with oil and gas producers, miners and developers on a a key piece of environment legislation, drawing the ire of dozens of academics.

item.title: Wednesday finance with Alan Kohler
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Toyah Cordingley's accused killer Rajwinder Singh had sand 'scattered' throughout car, Cairns court hears
item.description: The Supreme Court in Cairns has heard that Rajwinder Singh, who is accused of the 24-year-old's 2018 murder, first came to the attention of police because of his blue car, which they later searched.

item.title: South Africa defeat India by 408 runs in second Test match, win series 2-0
item.description: South Africa has clinched its first Test series win in India in 25 years with a crushing 408-run win in the second Test, claiming a 2-0 series sweep.

item.title: Floodwater rescues in Thailand's Songkhla province
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Melbourne Stars defeat Hobart Hurricanes by 37 runs in WBBL
item.description: The Melbourne Stars will carry solid momentum into Saturday's big WBBL local derby, easily beating top side Hobart by 37 runs.

item.title: Detectives carry out 'targeted search' for missing Ballarat woman Samantha Murphy
item.description: Detectives have conducted a search near Ballarat as part of the ongoing investigation into the disappearance of Victorian woman Samantha Murphy.

item.title: Man accused of international student's murder 'likely' had intellectual disability, court hears
item.description: A neuropsychologist has told the Northern Territory Supreme Court a man accused of murdering an international student in Darwin "likely" had an intellectual disability that impacted his ability to exercise self-control.

item.title: US National Parks to raise fees for millions of international tourists to popular sites
item.description: Changes set to take effect on January 1 will include annual park passes jumping to $US250 for foreign tourists, while US residents will continue to be charged $US80, according to authorities.

item.title: At least 36 people killed in high-rise apartment blazes in Hong Kong, 279 missing
item.description: Fires burn through the night and are yet to be extinguished as firefighters struggle to reach those in need.

item.title: Donald Trump defends Ukraine envoy Steve Witkoff after leak alleging he advised Kremlin aide
item.description: It comes as a senior Kremlin official confirms Steve Witkoff is set to visit Moscow next week as efforts to find a consensus on ending the nearly four-year war between Russia and Ukraine pick up speed.

item.title: Israel launches new military operation in northern West Bank
item.description: Israeli security forces have launched what the military described as a counter-terrorism operation in the northern West Bank, which Palestinians said was targeting the city of Tubas.

item.title: Former Marine Paul Doyle pleads guilty to Liverpool FC parade car ramming charges
item.description: More than 100 people were injured at a Liverpool Football Club victory parade in May.

item.title: The sound of a Martian dust devil
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Prawns, sneakers and spices: What we know about Indonesia's radioactive exports
item.description: Authorities in the US and Europe have recalled goods as Indonesian authorities investigate the source of radioactive contamination.

item.title: Judge dismisses 2020 election interference case against Donald Trump
item.description: The abandonment of the Georgia case is the latest reflection of how the US president has emerged largely unscathed from a spate of prosecutions that once threatened to imperil his political career.

item.title: Labor is celebrating a successful year but tough budget choices lie ahead
item.description: The level of the prime minister's reform appetite has been discussed and debated since roughly 9pm on election night in May, when Labor's massive win became clear.

item.title: Kangaroos player Ash Riddell has entire school behind her ahead of Saturday's AFLW grand final
item.description: Roos star — and grade 6 teacher — Ash Riddell has an entire school behind her ahead of this Saturday's AFLW grand final.

item.title: Australian music quiz: Test your knowledge of iconic Aussie acts
item.description: Celebrate Ausmusic T-Shirt Day with our Australian music trivia quiz. How well do you know your local legends?

item.title: One year before his 1978 assassination, California's first openly gay official Harvey Milk recorded his final words
item.description: Harvey Milk had been elected to the San Francisco Board of Supervisors in 1977 — a little over a year later, he would be dead.

item.title: Fire engulfs high-rise apartment buildings in Hong Kong
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Donald Trump is a 'master of dominating the news' and spotting his distractions can be difficult
item.description: What does a dead cat have to do with Donald Trump and the Epstein files? Everything, according to some experts.

item.title: Black Friday puts 'social pressure' on shoppers as more Australians rack up credit card debt
item.description: With millions of Australians tipped to spend record amounts this Black Friday, the value of personal credit and charge-card balances accruing interest has hit its highest level since 2021.

item.title: London Broncos rugby league hopes buoyed by Brisbane icon Darren Lockyer and players from PNG
item.description: The London Broncos might be the only rugby league club in Britain to have experienced relegation before a season even began — and Darren Lockyer, through the help of PNG Players, is hoping to bring them back.

item.title: 'Nudify' services used by Australian school students blocked after eSafety compliance action
item.description: The platforms, which can be used to make real people appear nude in photos and videos, have been used in several high-profile cases in Australian schools.

item.title: SA woman sues Noarlunga Hospital after suffering brain injury following alleged stroke misdiagnosis
item.description: An Adelaide woman is suing a southern suburbs hospital for $1.5 million in damages alleging she suffered a "permanent neurological injury" when doctors failed to diagnose her with a stroke, court documents reveal.

item.title: Guinea-Bissau military seizes control and arrests president and opposition leader
item.description: Guinea-Bissau's military says it has seized control of the country and arrested its president following the discovery of a plan to destabilise the coup-prone west African nation.

item.title: Rockliff's premiership tied to proposed stadium, but his is not the first to push a contentious project
item.description: With the vote to decide the fate of the Hobart stadium a week away, Premier Jeremy Rockliff's political legacy is in the balance.

item.title: NSW deputy coroner to decide if teen's death was caused by meat allergy from tick bites
item.description: Jeremy Webb died aged 16 after eating sausages while camping in the Central Coast. Growing up, he was bit by ticks outdoors multiple times.

item.title: Kempsey Shire Council launches 'squirrel campaign' to curb growing costs
item.description: A much-maligned piece of office equipment could end up gathering dust as a council on the NSW mid north coast looks for ways to rein in costs.

item.title: Optus and other telcos 'not meeting needs' of people with complaints over network issues: ombudsman
item.description: Optus has been under intense scrutiny after a network outage in September left hundreds of people unable to call Triple Zero and was linked to three deaths.

item.title: Queensland Premier David Crisafulli faces a political test on his home turf in Hinchinbrook by-election
item.description: If the electorate were to vote strongly against the government, it would sting first-term leader David Crisafulli and be spun as a rejection of the LNP's agenda, writes Alex Brewster.

item.title: Here is what we know about Hong Kong's Tai Po fire and the role of bamboo scaffolding
item.description: The blaze in Tai Po that engulfed multiple high-rise apartment blocks is still burning, and authorities say it likely began in bamboo scaffolding that encased the buildings.

item.title: Anglican Diocese of Ballarat selling properties, closing local parish due to abuse payouts
item.description: An Anglican bishop says regional dioceses around Australia are facing financial pressure and potential closure due to having to pay millions of dollars to abuse victim-survivors.

item.title: Hong Kong fire live updates: Three arrested after at least 36 killed in high-rise apartment blaze
item.description: At least 36 people are dead and others remain trapped after a massive fire that engulfed multiple high-rise towers at a residential complex in Hong Kong, with police arresting three people on suspicion of manslaughter. Follow live.

item.title: Cricket and hockey among sports in contention to return for 2030 Commonwealth Games in India
item.description: Australia is expecting to see its medal chances boosted at the 2030 Commonwealth Games in Ahmedabad as sports such as cricket and hockey remain in contention to return.

item.title: Mother calls for new age limits after 8yo son killed in e-motorcycle crash
item.description: Kloe Weedon's son Zeke William Hondow, a schoolboy with a sharp wit and even sharper haircuts, was farewelled at a funeral last week.

item.title: Two National Guard members shot near White House in Washington DC
item.description: Two members of the West Virginia National Guard have been shot near the White House, according to that state's governor. He says there are "conflicting reports" about their condition.

item.title: Federal politics live: Labor strikes deal to overhaul environmental protection laws
item.description: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese says Labor has struck a deal to overhaul the nation's outdated environmental protection laws. Follow live.

item.title: South-east Queensland braces for intense heatwave and more storm activity
item.description: South-east Queensland is set to swelter through the next few days, with forecast temperatures way above average and more storms on the way.

item.title: Kotoni Staggs will continue to represent Kangaroos if Kevin Walters remains coach
item.description: Kotoni Staggs must decide between representing Australia or Tonga at the international level, and says there is one key factor that will tip his decision either way.

item.title: TagEnergy Naracoorte big battery project raises concerns about take-up of agricultural land
item.description: One of Australia's largest battery energy storage systems would be built on farmland in South Australia's south-east in a proposal that the developer says will lower electricity costs.

item.title: 'You can't get this thing wrong.': Ted O'Brien on the teen social media ban
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Queensland potato farmers help fill supply gap as southern drought causes national shortage
item.description: Potato growers in Queensland's far north are suddenly in hot demand as drought-stricken paddocks in the country's south fail to deliver.

item.title: Live updates: Australian share market to rise as Wall St rally continues
item.description: A rally on Wall Street is likely to send Australian stocks higher as revived tech strength and the growing probability of a December interest rate cut from the US Federal Reserve put investors in a buying mood the day before the Thanksgiving holiday. Follow the latest updates in our live blog.

item.title: Thousands still without power in Western Sydney as outages plague NSW residents
item.description: Thousands of residents in Western Sydney are waking up without power and some schools across NSW will be closed after freak storms on Wednesday.

item.title: Global miner BMA drops Queensland mine expansion plan after a decade of environmental checks
item.description: The project would have cleared more than 100 hectares of koala habitat.

item.title: Suicide Prevention Australia issues report linking adverse childhood experiences with suicide risk
item.description: Suicide Prevention Australia says there's an "urgent" need for action to stop the "significant and lasting" impact of childhood trauma.
